text.__SUMMARY__: Neochen barbadiana is an extinct species of goose from the Late Pleistocene of Barbados. The species was described by American paleontologist Pierce Brodkorb from fossils found in Ragged Point, Saint Philip. This was the third fossil species of the genus to be described, after Neochen pugil and N. debilis, from Brazil and Argentina, respectively.
